messages.message:
Hi team,
dogfood seems to be down. I am seeing Internal Server Errors but the cluster itself looks healthy. I didn’t see any errors other than `[ warn] [filter:kubernetes:kubernetes.0] invalid pattern for given tag kube.var.ib.log.logrotate.log` in webservices.

I see a lot of pods with `shutdown` state though. Could this be related to the issue?

I don’t think the pods in shutdown state is a problem as some of them have been around for days. I think we should clean them up if those pods are not required.

I can see errors in webapp though which might be related -
```2022-07-12 19:04:09	
[2022-07-12 13:34:09 +0000] [28] [ERROR] Error handling request /
2022-07-12 19:04:09	
ERROR:manage:Exception on / [GET]
2022-07-12 19:04:08	
ERROR:root:Received exception in WEBAPP: Protocol message CoreApp has no singular "acl_actions" field.```
I don’t see any code changes that look suspicious, @puneet let’s declare an incident?
